Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617. If you do not submit the
CWL-4617, it will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
Youth attack youth and staff do not protect them. Staff encourage
youth to fight and praise youth after they fight.
Allegation 2:
Staff 5 was aware Youth B had a piece of glass and was
threatening to harm herself and did not intervene.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth A said she has never seen or been asked by staff
to fight another youth. Youth A said staff always intervene and
stop the fights and then the youth fighting are given
consequences.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2025.
Youth B said the staff did not tell or ask the youth to fight but
would tell youth what another youth said to purposely make them
upset and want to fight with each other. Youth B said “all the staff”
would gossip about the youth and share information about other
youth.
2

Youth C was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth C however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth C at the facility, however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth C at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth D said the youth are never allowed to fight and
staff do everything they can to prevent or stop them from fighting.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth E said she has never seen or heard staff encourage
or ask youth to fight each other. Youth E said staff will always give
youth consequences if they fight.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center on May 29, 2025. Youth F said she was involved in two
incidents where staff encouraged youth to fight her. Youth F said
the first incident was when Former Youth 1 texted her and told her
that Staff 9 had asked her to fight Youth F but that it never
happened. The second time Youth F said she was encouraged to
fight Youth A by a “brand new staff”, she could not remember his
name, and stated he no longer is employed. Youth F said she
fought with Youth A and Staff 6, Staff 2, and Supervisor X were
aware and broke up the fight once it started.
Youth G was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth G said she has never seen or heard of youth
being allowed or asked to fight. Youth G said staff physically
intervene to stop fights when there are four staff, if there are less
than four the staff will verbally tell the youth to stop fighting.
Youth H was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth H said she has never seen or heard staff
encouraging or asking youth to fight one another. Youth H said
staff have always broken up fights when they occur at the facility.
Youth I was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth I said the staff do not allow youth to fight however
only break up fights when there are at least four staff. Youth I said
when there are less than four staff the staff will verbally redirect
the youth to stop but do not physically attempt to stop them. Youth
I said she has never heard or seen staff asking youth to fight
3

however some youth will have certain “staff’s back” and will fight
youth that give that staff issues and then staff will “thank” the girl
who “had their back”. Youth I was not able to provide specific
incident, staff, or youth involved in this behavior.
Former Youth 1 was interviewed face-to-face at Mott
Children’s Residence on July 16, 2025. Former Youth 1 said
she was never asked to fight Youth F by Staff 9. Former Youth 1
said Staff 9 was always very encouraging to her and the other
youth and wanted them all to do well and make good choices.
Former Youth 1 said she never was asked by any staff to fight or
heard of staff allowing or encouraging youth to fight one another.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on June 26, 2025. Staff 1
said Staff 11 would encourage the youth to fight one another and
was terminated. Staff 1 said she has not seen or heard any other
staff encourage or ask youth to fight one another.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 2
said she never saw or heard of staff asking youth to fight one
another. Staff 2 said she and other staff would always break up
the fights and give consequences to the youth that were fighting.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 3
said he never heard or saw any staff asking or allowing the youth
to fight. Staff 3 said staff never gave praise to youth that fought
but rather gave them consequences for poor choices.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 4
said he never saw or heard of staff asking or tell youth to fight
each other. Staff 4 said staff always intervened in the fights and
then gave consequences to youth that were fighting.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 30, 2025. Staff 5
said she never saw or heard of staff encouraging youth to fight or
praising them when they fought.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on June 30, 2025. Staff 6
said he never heard or saw any staff encouraging youth to fight or
asking them to fight on their behalf.
Staff 9 is a former staff at Vista Maria. Phone Attempts to
interview her took place on June 25, 2025, July 10, 2025, and
August 11, 2025. Staff 9 did not answer the phone or return the
messages left for her.
4

Staff 13 was interviewed via telephone on August 4, 2025.
Staff 13 said she is a former third shift Team Lead for Rose Hall.
Staff 13 said she has never seen or heard of staff encouraging
youths to fight or praise them when they fight.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on July 2, 2025.
Therapist said she has never seen or heard of staff encouraging
or praising youth to fight one another.
Supervisor Z was interviewed via telephone on July 14, 2025.
Supervisor Z said she has never seen staff allow youth to fight,
praise them for fighting or asking youth to fight.
Supervisor Y was interviewed via telephone on August 11,
2025. Supervisor Y said he has never seen or heard of the staff
members allowing youth to fight, asking them to fight, or giving
them praise once a fight is completed. Supervisor Y said staff
intervene and do what they are able to stop youth from fighting
one another.
Supervisor X was interviewed via telephone on July 14, 2025.
Supervisor X said he does not work on Rose Hall or supervise the
staff directly rather is a trainer and will assist at times at the
different programs. Supervisor X said he has never seen or heard
of staff allowing the youth to fight one another and stated they are
trained in different techniques on how to intervene when youth
begin to verbally and physically fight.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
Interview dates and places for Allegation 2 were as indicated
under Allegation 1 unless otherwise indicated.
During her interview, Youth A said she heard Staff 5 told Youth B
“you do too much so go ahead” referring to Youth B cutting
herself. Youth A said she could not remember if any other staff
were present at that time.
Youth B stated in her interview that on May 8, 2025, Staff 5 and
Staff 9 were working and aware that she was going to cut herself
and that she had a piece of glass in her bra. Youth B said she told
Staff 5 she was going to “slit my throat” and Staff 5 responded
saying “you aren’t about that life” and walked away leaving her
alone in the bathroom. Youth B said she cut her arms and then
came out of the bathroom and neither Staff 5 nor Staff 9 asked her
5

any questions or provided her any attention. Youth B said when
the third shift supervisor [Staff 13] arrived at work, she was unable
to recall the name of the supervisor, she told her about cutting and
she called a therapist and was placed on “suicide ideation”. Youth
B said she was not sure if she was on a safety plan and has not
had any additional treatment since the incident.
Youth D said she was on the wing the night that Youth B said she
was going to cut herself and had glass. Youth D said Staff 5 said
“you ain’t about that life” and then left Youth B in the bathroom
and she cut herself. Youth D said Staff 5 knew that Youth B had
glass and heard her tell the second staff working about it,
however, could not remember which staff were working.
Youth E said Youth B was threatening to cut herself and Staff 5
said “you ain’t about that life” however Staff 5 did not know Youth
B had glass. Youth E said she does not know if Youth B ended up
cutting herself or not.
Youth F said Staff 5 ignored Youth B when Youth B told her she
was going to “kill herself”. Youth F was unsure if any other staff
were present when Youth B said this to Staff 5.
When Youth G was interviewed she did not have any information
about Youth B cutting or Staff 5 allowing it to occur.
Youth H said she is not aware of Staff 5 allowing Youth B to have
glass or cut herself.
When Youth I was interviewed she did not have any information
regarding Youth B’s self-harming and Staff 5 allowing it.
During Staff 1’s interview she said she was not present when
Youth B cut herself, however when she came in for a shift the
beginning of May Youth B told her that she cut herself and it was
“written up and staff handled it”.
Staff 2 said Youth B told her about the self-harm incident and
when she asked Staff 5 she denied it. Staff 2 said she was not
present during the situation.
Staff 3 said he has no knowledge of the incident with Youth B and
Staff 5.
Staff 4 said he was not present during the incident with Youth B
and Staff 5, however, did note that Staff 5 told him she was weary
6

about working with certain youth and Youth B was one of the
youth she had concerns about.
Staff 5 said she worked many shifts with Youth B and never heard
her making any suicidal threats. Staff 5 said she never heard
Youth B say she was going to slit her throat or allowed Youth B to
have any sharps including glass. Staff 5 said she never made any
statement to Youth B about “you’re not about that life”. Staff 5 said
she recalled a time when she was off for a few days and when she
returned to work Youth B was on “100% supervision” for making
suicidal statements.
Staff 6 said he has no information or knowledge about Youth B
cutting herself during Staff 5’s shift.
During her interview Staff 13 said she was working the night of
May 5, 2025, when Youth B came to her and told her she wanted
to “slice herself” and was thinking of other ways to hurt herself.
Staff 13 said she talked to Youth B for a period of time and then
called Clinical Supervisor who talked to Youth B and then directed
Staff 13 what to do. Staff 13 said she completed a risk
assessment that resulted in Youth B scoring “acute positive”. Staff
13 said she cleared out Youth B’s room and called the on-call
nurse who placed her on the psychiatrist’s schedule for the
following morning. Staff 13 said she provided Youth B her PRN,
Olanzapine, and she went to bed. Staff 13 said she placed Youth
B on suicidal ideation observation. Staff 13 denied Youth B ever
telling her that Staff 5 was aware of her cutting or having glass.
Therapist said she became Youth B’s therapist in early May
2025. Therapist said Youth B told her that Staff 5 knowingly left
her unattended with glass which she used to self-harm. Therapist
said Youth B was on “observation” supervision after the incident
and the paperwork stated it was due to threatened harm as she
had cut her arms. Therapist said Youth B saw a psychiatrist and
she debriefed with her afterwards. Therapist said she did not talk
to anyone about Staff 5’s behavior in this incident.
Supervisor Z said she has never heard of Staff 5 allowing Youth
B or any other youth to self-harm.
Supervisor Y said he had no information regarding the
allegations of Staff 5 allowing Youth B to cut herself.
Supervisor X said he has no information about the incident with
Youth B on May 8, 2025.
7

Clinical Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on August
12, 2025. Clinical Supervisor said staff will call her when youth are
making threats of suicide or self-harm and she provides further
instructions and guidance on the next steps. Clinical Supervisor
said she does not remember all the details of the call in early May
regarding Youth B however said she did instruct staff to complete
a suicide assessment. Clinical Supervisor denied Youth B ever
telling her that Staff 5 was aware of her having glass and did not
stop her from harming herself. Clinical Supervisor said she has
spoken to Youth B over the phone as well as in person and this
was never disclosed to her.
Documents Reviewed:
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy was reviewed.
The policy outlines the expectations for staff to intervene
with youth should they become a harm to self or others.
The policy further outlines that staff are prohibited from
allowing youth to participate in behavior interventions with
other youth.
• Incident Report dated May 5, 2025, written by Staff 13. The
incident report is consistent with Staff 13’s interview.
• Suicide Risk Assessment for Youth B dated May 5, 2025,
was reviewed. The assessment was completed by Staff 13
and provided directive for Youth B to be placed on suicidal
ideation observation and to contact the on-call therapist
and nurse.
• Safety Plan for Youth B dated May 6, 2025, was reviewed.
The safety plan was completed by Therapist and Youth B
and identifies individuals Youth B feels comfortable talking
to when upset, coping skills, and places to go when upset.
• Vista Maria Suicide Prevention Policy was reviewed. The
policy states “Vista Mara takes any threat of suicide
seriously and will take all steps necessary to prevent
suicide amount our clients.” Further it describes
“Observation” status as “staff to accompany the client
throughout the entire shift”.
• Vista Maria Work Instruction for Suicide Prevention and the
Suicide Prevention Checklist were reviewed. The
documents outline step by step instructions for the staff
when responding to youth making threats of suicide. The
responsibilities outlined are consistent with Staff 13’s
incident report and interview.
• Staff 5’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 5 completed Policy and Procedure Review
training on May 24, 2023.
8

• Staff 11’s personnel file: There was discipline on October 4,
2024, for leaving a cell phone unattended; and on January
28, 2025, for cell phone usage. Staff 11 completed her
Program Overview training on July 17, 2024.
Analysis Allegation 1:
The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation. Youth A, Youth B, Youth D,
Youth E, Youth G, Youth H, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff
6, Staff 13, Therapist, Supervisory Z, Supervisor Y, and
Supervisor X all reported that staff do not allow youth to fight and
will intervene and provide consequences to youth that fight. Youth
I reported that staff do not allow or ask youth to fight however has
“thanked” them once they have fought other youth, however, was
not able to provide specific incident, staff, or youth involved in this.
Youth F reported Staff 9 asked Former Youth 1 to fight her
however Former Youth 1 denied this occurring. Staff 1 reported
that Staff 11 had previously encouraged youths to fight however
no other staff, supervisor, or youths reported this occurred.
Allegation 2:
The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation. Youth A, Youth D, Youth E,
and Youth F reported varying information regarding Youth B
having glass, cutting, and Staff 5’s response. Staff 5 denied Youth
B ever telling her she had thoughts of self-harm, knowing she had
glass, or cutting herself on her shift. Staff 13 and Clinical
Supervisor both reported Youth B sharing thoughts of self-harm
and taking the appropriate steps to place her on Observation
Status, both denied Youth B telling them that Staff 5 had
awareness of her self-harming thoughts and did not act on them.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section Staff to resident ratio
Description (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond with
the institution's purpose and the needs of the residents and shall
assure the continual safety, protection, and direct care and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility is short-staffed.
9

Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth A said there are two youth on her wing and one
staff works with them. Youth A said there are not enough staff
working to take the youths to do any off-campus activities.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2025.
Youth B said there was never enough staff working to deal with all
of the issues the youth were having at the facility. Youth B said
youth were able to get to other youth to fight and the staff were
always stating there were not enough staff working.
Youth C was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth E however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth E at the facility, however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth D said there were two youth and one staff
working her unit. Youth D said there were never enough staff to
assist in a crisis situation. Youth D said for the past “few weeks”
there have not been enough staff for the youth to even leave the
Rose Hall building.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth E said she is on a wing with two other youths and
usually one staff. Youth E said there is “never” enough staff to
deal with the youth’s behaviors.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center on May 29, 2025. Youth F said there were two youth on
her wing when she left and there were always two staff working
with them. Youth F said “almost daily” there were not enough staff
working for them to go on off campus activities.
Youth G was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth G said there are three youths on each wing and
one staff. Youth G said there are not enough staff to help with
youth who are acting out.
Youth H was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth H said she does not know if there are enough
staff but noted there are always staff on her wing with her.
10

Youth I was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth I said typically there are three youth on a wing with
one staff. Youth I said there have been incidents when youth are
on a one-to-one supervision and there are not staff to provide
supervision to the youth. Youth I said there are not enough staff to
help out when another staff calls for assistance.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on June 26, 2025. Staff 1
said the facility did not have enough staff working on shifts to deal
with the behaviors the youth were exhibiting on the wings. Staff 1
said this would occur frequently and mostly on second shift.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 2
said there is one staff to each wing and therefore no extra staff to
assist in situations when there is crisis or help needed.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 3
said the staff “may be out of the 1:3 ratio at times” but the main
issue was “not enough staff to handle all the issues with the girls”.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff 4
said there was enough staff on each shift to “meet the 1:3 ratio”
however there were not enough staff when youth had issues to
provide assistance to one another without going out of ratio.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 30, 2025. Staff 5
said there were many times when there were not enough staff to
work with the youth, both for maintaining ratio and for handling
crisis situations. Staff 5 said the staff would maintain supervision
the best they were able and move around the building as quickly
as possible to help staff, calling for extra around campus as
needed.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on June 30, 2025. Staff 6
said they were very short-staffed and many times out of ratio as
well as not having enough staff to assist in crisis moments with the
youth.
Staff 13 was interviewed via telephone on August 4, 2025.
Staff 13 said she is a former third shift Team Lead for Rose Hall.
Staff 13 said she was never short staffed on her shift and if
needed would mandate someone from second shift to stay or she
would call around campus and get assistance as needed.
11

Therapist was interviewed via telephone on July 2, 2025.
Therapist said she has not had anything to do with the staffing on
the wings and does not know if they were short staffed.
Supervisor Z was interviewed via telephone on July 14, 2025.
Supervisor Z said the day shift has always been covered and had
additional staff present for situations requiring assistance.
Supervisor Z said they have had to mandate one or two staff per
shift for second shift due to staff calling into work. Supervisor Z
said second shift still runs “ok” however there have been a few
days when they were short staffed.
Supervisor Y was interviewed via telephone on August 11,
2025. Supervisor Y said the ratio at Rose Hall is one staff for three
youth and there have been occasions when they have not been in
ratio. Supervisor Y said in May there were many staff out on
medical leave as well as staff that called in frequently due to the
youth’s behaviors on Rose Hall. Supervisor Y said there was
shortage of staff to work and assist during May.
Supervisor X was interviewed via telephone on July 14, 2025.
Supervisor X said he does not work on Rose Hall or supervise the
staff directly rather is a trainer and will assist at times at the
different programs. Supervisor X said he is not aware of any
staffing or scheduling issues.
Documents Reviewed:
• Vista Maria Client Supervision Policy was reviewed. The
policy states “Clients on all units are to be continually
supervised. Staff members who are responsible for client
supervision should maintain line of sight management of
those clients at all times.”
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy was reviewed.
The policy states “Staff must use the least restrictive,
safety, and most effective methods and recognize that
symptoms are adaptations.” It also outlines that “two or
more trained/certified employees must be present be
physical interventions are performed”.
• Vista Maria Mental Health Program Statement indicates
“Direct Staff ratio – 1:3; and 1:10 (midnight shift) Sleeping
hours are 11 p.m. – 7a.m. on weekdays and weekends.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there was an overall report that the agency did not have
enough staff working, especially second shift, to provide for the
needs of the youth and ensure the continual safety, protection,
12

and direct care and supervision, even during times the agency
was within their approved ratio. Youth A, Youth B, Youth D, Youth
E, Youth G, and Youth I reported consistent information about not
having enough staff on shift when there were youth having
behavioral issues. Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4 Staff 5, Staff 6,
Supervisor Z, and Supervisor Y reported consistent information
about not having enough staff for support when crisis situations
arise. Staff 5, Staff 6, and Supervisor Y reported times when the
agency would not have enough staff to meet the required ratio.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2025SIC0000654 Approved 6/26/25, CAP Approved 7/23/25
SIR 2025SIC0000170 Approved 2/7/25, CAP Approved 2/25/25
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff speak to the youth inappropriately and are disrespectful to
the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth A said staff have never been disrespectful or
talked to her inappropriately.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2025.
Youth B said “all the staff” were rude and disrespectful in the way
they talked to the youth. Youth B said there was a day when she
tripped and a staff said, “are you slow”, another staff yelled at her
on occasion, and another staff called her “light skinned shit”.
Youth B said staff would also make general statements about the
youth such as their “cooties stink” or argue with the youth as if
they were peers. Youth B did not have specific staff or dates these
things occurred but rather said it was frequent with all staff.
13

Youth C was not able to be interviewed. On May 7, 2025, an
attempt was made to interview Youth E however she was not at
the facility. On May 22, 2025, an attempt was made to interview
Youth E at the facility, however she was escalated and refused to
be interviewed. On May 27, 2025, an attempt was made to
interview Youth E at the facility however she was escalated and
refused to be interviewed.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth D said “all” the Rose Hall staff make comments
such as “do something and see what I do”, “bitch, I wish you
would touch me”, call the youth “gutter life”, and “I wish a resident
would”. Youth D said this is “all staff” however Staff 1 “does it the
most”.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth E said she has not had any issues with staff speaking
disrespectfully towards her or making inappropriate comments to
her.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at Osceola Youth
Center on May 29, 2025. Youth F said, “all the staff” would cuss
at the youth and make statements about their jobs being
“irritating”. Youth F said many staff, unable to remember who,
would say they were going to “fight” the youth. Youth F said she
believes one staff, unsure which staff, did fight with Youth I during
her placement. Youth F said “all staff” would make comments
about losing their jobs over the youth or handing in their keys
because they were tired of the youths’ behaviors.
Youth G was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth G said she has never been mistreated or had any
staff talk to her disrespectfully or inappropriately. Youth G did not
have any concerns about the way staff interacted or treated the
youth.
Youth H was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
27, 2025. Youth H said a few staff have “attitudes” with the youth
and speak to them in an “rude” tone. Youth A said she remembers
Staff 7 telling saying “if you walk up on me, I will hit you”.
Youth I was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth I said some of the staff will argue back and forth with
the youth, making them upset however she was not able to
provide names of staff or specific incidents when it has occurred.
14

Youth I said she has never had staff threaten her or say
inappropriate things to her.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on June 26, 2025. Staff 1
